text: Tom Gormley (29 July 1916 – 1984) was a politician in Northern Ireland. Born in Claudy, Gormley became a farmer before following his brother Paddy into politics. He was elected to Strabane Rural District Council in 1947, and to Tyrone County Council in 1950.Biographies of Members of the Northern Ireland House of Commons At the 1958 Northern Ireland general election, Gormley stood as an Independent Farmers' Candidate on a nationalist platform. At the 1962 election, he was elected for the official Nationalist Party. With his brother, he represented the liberal tendency in the party.George Thayer, The British Political Fringe: A Profile In November 1969, Gormley resigned to sit as an Independent Nationalist, and in 1972, he joined the Alliance Party of Northern Ireland (APNI). He stood unsuccessfully in Mid Ulster for APNIMid Ulster 1973–82 at the 1973 Northern Ireland Assembly election, but was elected to Strabane District Council, on which he served until 1977. ==References== Category:1916 births Category:1984 deaths Category:People from County Londonderry Category:Members of Strabane District Council Category:Members of Tyrone County Council Category:Alliance Party of Northern Ireland members of the House of Commons of Northern Ireland Category:Members of the House of Commons of Northern Ireland 1962–1965 Category:Members of the House of Commons of Northern Ireland 1965–1969 Category:Members of the House of Commons of Northern Ireland 1969–1973 Category:Nationalist Party (Ireland) members of the House of Commons of Northern Ireland Category:Independent members of the House of Commons of Northern Ireland Category:Members of the House of Commons of Northern Ireland for County Tyrone constituencies Category:Alliance Party of Northern Ireland councillors
title: Tom Gormley (politician)
